page.title: 11SUDELEY CASTLE - HISTORY Pt1
page.content: The name Sudeley, comes from two Saxon words - 'sud' 'lega' which means south place. The castle was a Royal Manor which belonged to King Ethelred II. In Saxon times the castle was at the centre of the Kingdom of Mercia. (7) Sudeley was a very important place. In 1066, after the Norman conquest, William gave away all the best land. The castle then belonged to the De Mantes family. As they were part French they were able to keep the castle. After the De Mantes family had died, they left the property to the De Sudeley family.They were in occupation at the time of King Stephen. John De Sudeley married Matilda, and after disagreements with King Stephen the castle was lost to the family and turned into a garrison. After the King's death, the castle returned to the De Sudeley's remaining until 1367.
